definition: abstinence/to give up (a bad habit)
to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
variant of 絕|绝[jue2]

sentences.english: The goal is complete abstention from all mind-altering substances.
sentences.chinese: 目标是彻底戒绝所有致幻物质。

sentences.english: You must keep your father off strong spirits.
sentences.chinese: 你必须让你父亲戒绝烈酒。

sentences.english: In addition, in terms of which type of meat people should give up, there are varied scales.
sentences.chinese: 而且，在戒绝肉食的种类上也有不同的等级。

sentences.english: And he emphasised that he eschewed luxuries.
sentences.chinese: 他强调说自己戒绝奢侈品。

sentences.english: How foolish and petty it would have been to deny oneself this small luxury.
sentences.chinese: 戒绝这种小小的奢侈享受那就实在太愚蠢，太小气了。

definition: to quit/to give up (a bad habit)
to totally prohibit/to put an end to
to end abstinence/to resume (drinking) after a break/to break (a taboo)
to abstain from/to prohibit (certain foods etc)
to give up drinking/to abstain from drinking
bad habit/vice
to fast
to go against the rules (of a religious order)/to break a ban (e.g. medical)
to try everything to avoid/to guard against
to mend one's ways
to fast
to laze about without doing anything productive
commandment/precept
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to warn (against some course)/to admonish
old habit/former custom
